Title: The Other Dream Team
Review: The story of the '88 USSR Olympic Basketball team, much of which went on to form to team of the '92 team for the newly restored Lithuania.  Really great story

Title: Iron Sky
Review: Really slow.  Funny at times, an impressive effort, but not a good movie.

Title: The King of Devil's Island
Review: Fine.  I know nothing about the real life prison this film is set in, but it was very predictable for 2/3rds of the film.  But the ending kind of redeemed it a bit for me.

Title: Django Unchained
Review: Fantastic.  I really, really enjoyed it.

Title: Zero Dark Thirty
Review: OK...  Both the ridiculous praise of this film and the criticism of it's portrayal of torture are overblown.

Title: Silver Linings Playbook
Review: A nice romantic comedy.. There were lots of unwell characters in this film, and the actors did well playing them

Title: Les Misérables
Review: I definitely still don’t like musicals. Hooper needs to get over his hard-on for extreme close ups and profile. Hugh and Anne owned.

Title: The Impossible
Review: Amazing Tsunami scenes. Naomi Watts was good, Tom Holland was impressive. A bit manipulative in the last 30m.

Title: 30 for 30: You Don't Know Bo
Review: A great reminder of the phenomenon that Bo Jackson really was...  The 30 for 30 series is great...

Title: Blazing Saddles
Review: Way more disjoint than I remembered... And the completely random ending didn't get stored in my memory at all...  Totally caught me by surprise.

Title: Sound of My Voice
Review: If you're looking for a film with definitive answers, this is not the film.  Very interesting but just a touch frustrating.

Title: Amour
Review: Not that good, nowhere as awful as I feared..  Needed serious editing.  Very much a French film.

Title: Sound City
Review: An ode to one of the great analog recording studios.  Tons of great interviews with musicians of several generations.

Title: The Dark Knight Rises
Review: Still really enjoyed this one...

Title: Young Frankenstein
Review: Still amazing.

Title: Pulp Fiction
Review: Holds up great, though there were times that the dialogue felt noticiably constructed.  After seeing Django it is clear that QT has gotten better at his job.

Title: Star Wars
Review: Got the "DeSpecialized Editions" fan edit of the original trilogy. Start with the Special Edition Blu-Rays and then remove all the Lucas revisionist shit (while leaving some of the touchups).  Really great (both the edits and the movie).

Title: How to Survive a Plague
Review: Moving documentary about the AIDS crisis and the fight to expedite medication approval (and discovery).

Title: Side Effects
Review: Surprising yet somehow unfulfilling. Not bad, but didn’t really do all that much for me

Title: The Empire Strikes Back
Review: Also "DeSpecialized".  So great.

Title: Return of the Jedi
Review: Also "DeSpecialized".  While no Empire, this movie holds a special place in my heart.

Title: Fresh Guacamole
Review: Good, but not as good as the groups previous short, WESTERN SPAGHETTI

Title: Skyfall
Review: Coco hadn't seen this so I saw it again.  Felt a little longer this time around, but I still enjoyed myself.

Title: Death of a Shadow (Dood Van Een Schaduw)
Review: Weird little steampunk-ish fantasy... Pretty cool.

Title: Henry
Review: The exact opposite of subtle.

Title: Curfew
Review: Super-precocious child meets complete trainwreck of an uncle.  Works better than it sounds

Title: Buzkashi Boys
Review: I feel like I've seen a version of this 3000 times ("coming of age" guh).  But this is a well made version of this story.

Title: Asad
Review: Very sweet....

Title: Maggie Simpson in "The Longest Daycare"
Review: "Raggety Ayn Rand Dolls"

Title: Paperman
Review: Cute short that did a phenomenal job of mixing hand and computer animation.

Title: Head Over Heels
Review: Claymation short that shows how awful women can be until a man does something nice.  Or something.

Title: Adam and Dog
Review: If the story of Adam & Eve wasn't dumb enough already, add in a somehow domesticated dog.

Title: Mea Maxima Culpa: Silence in the House of God
Review: Just when you think the Catholic Church can't get any more awful...

Title: GLOW: The Story of the Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling
Review: Lots of fun, brought back some great memories.

Title: Casino
Review: Somehow I had never seen this movie.  Not Scorcese's best, but pretty good

Title: The Amazing Spider-Man
Review: Completely unnecessary reboot.  How many origin stories do we need?  And the POV shots made me actively angry.

Title: Oz the Great and Powerful
Review: OK, kind of felt a little TOO homage-y, ala Superman Returns....

Title: Iron Man
Review: Still lots of fun, probably my second-favorite Marvel movie behind The Avengers.

Title: Monsters
Review: Cool little alien movie, wasn't totally satisfied by the end but the ride was good

Title: TPB AFK: The Pirate Bay Away from Keyboard
Review: Well crafted doc on covering the Swedish trial (and appeals) of The Pirate Bay

Title: This is Spinal Tap
Review: Nuff Said.

Title: Minecraft: The Story of Mojang
Review: I really thought a 90 minute doc on Minecraft would drag but it really didn't.  I knew alot of the info in this movie but still enjoyed it.

Title: The World According to Dick Cheney
Review: Like most HBO documentaries, this one was profoundly depressing.  It is amazing how in the bubble and justified Cheney seems to be.

Title: Room 237
Review: You need to A) Be a huge Shining (or Kubrick) nerd and B) ver tolerant of conspiracy/extrapolation theories to enjoy this movie.  But if you meet those criteria you'll get a kick out of it

Title: X-Men: First Class
Review: This was randomly on cable when we turned on the TV and we got sucked into it.  Still lots of fun

Title: Spring Breakers
Review: I have really mixed feelings about this film.  I swung from disliking it to loving it throughout.  I THINK I liked it???

Title: Friends with Kids
Review: Very meh.

Title: The Friends of Eddie Coyle
Review: A really good movie.  Small, well-acted, and clever in a "not in your face" way.

Title: Visitor Q
Review: Often Japanese 'fucked up' movies are shocking just for the sake of being shocking.  This one falls into that category, but at least it's funny at the same time. :)

Title: Evil Dead (2013)
Review: Different from it's predecessors but quite good.

Title: Howard the Duck
Review: Holy god is this bad.

Title: Hot Fuzz
Review: Still so awesome.

Title: Upstream Color
Review: I really liked this movie, but I totally understand why others may not.  I found it riveting.

Title: iSteve
Review: I learned so much about Steve Jobs and Apple that I had never known.  Mostly because it was all made up.

Title: Killing Them Softly
Review: Meh

Title: Nitro Circus: The Movie
Review: Fun, but not as good as Jackass.  The TV show was better.
Exactly what you'd expect..  A straigth ahead biopic that is pretty melodramatic at times.

Title: The Spectacular Now
Review: Lovely. Refreshing to have a film with teens who seem like real people instead of over-the-top nonsense. In the spirit of John Hughes. #IFFBoston

Title: Before You Know It
Review: Good but could have been great if it lost about 30m. #iffboston

Title: Houston
Review: A gorgeous yet depressing look of addiction.  An interesting dramatic take. #iffboston

Title: The Punk Singer
Review: A great look at the life and work of Kathleen Hanna.  Really tight and great interviews. #iffboston

Title: Our Nixon
Review: ok, but it kinda felt like yet another Watergate doc. The home movie footage wasn’t all that compelling. #IFFBoston

Title: Sightseers
Review: A really fun time. Big thanks to @mr_wheatley for such a fun film. #IFFBoston

Title: Persistence of Vision
Review: a great doc about Richard Williams and his failed 25+ year quest to make his animated masterpiece. #iffboston

Title: Much Ado About Nothing (2013)
Review: a nice take on The Bard. I always have some difficulty with his prose, but it was lots of fun

Title: Dirty Wars
Review: Looked at all of the undeclared, covert military actions the US is taking all over the world.  Deeply troubling. #iffboston

Title: The Hunt
Review: a drama about how a little lie can spiral into something terrible. Felt a bit manipulated by the end but still good. #iffboston

Title: The Defector
Review: OK but I think the director was dangerous when it came to protecting identity. #IFFBoston

Title: Remote Area Medical
Review: spent a weekend with RAM in Appalachia.  An good look at an often overlooked failing of our medical system. #IFFBoston

Title: The Act of Killing
Review: one of the most powerful documentaries I’ve ever seen.  Profoundly disturbing.  #IFFBoston

Title: The East
Review: A good thriller set in the world of eco-anarchists.  I love Marling and Skarsgård and they carried this well.  #IFFBoston

Title: Some Girl(s)
Review: Blah blah blah caricatures of people acting like no people on earth.  Don't watch this movie.

Title: Willow Creek
Review: Probably the first found footage movie I’ve liked since BLAIR WITCH.  Bobcat got it done.  #IFFBoston

Title: In A World...
Review: A fun and funny way to end this year's #IFFBoston.

Title: Django Unchained
Review: Possibly better the second time.

Title: The Act of Killing
Review: Stil just as powerful the second time.  FUMN crowd seemed to agree.

Title: The Catechism Cataclysm
Review: Not quite as awesome as I remembered it, but still pretty funny.

Title: Upstream Color
Review: A movie that definitely improves on the second viewing..

Title: The Arrested Development Documentary
Review: Fun, but suffered from not having ANY content from the show itself (save for a few stills) whic hwould have helped provide context.

Title: Iron Man 3
Review: okay… Slow start, Some of the plot was extra inane & often the ‘suspense’ missed the mark. But it had some dumb fun moments

Title: American Grindhouse
Review: Generic docu-clip-talking-head thing on grindhouse movies.

Title: Contagion
Review: Still a good movie, watched again with Coco's parents.

Title: Star Trek: Into Darkness
Review: I liked this movie, worked on several levels for me...  Not as much fun as the first one, but still quite good.  Some of the nods to TOS were too much, though

Title: Leviathan
Review: if you’re looking for an incoherent, poorly edited mess of a film that calls itself a doc but documents little, this is for you!

Title: Behind the Candelabra
Review: I generally hate biopics, and I wanted to hate this so badly but I couldn't.

Title: Deceptive Practice: The Mysteries and Mentors of Ricky Jay
Review: I knew that Ricky Jay was a magician and sometimes actor, but that is basically all I knew going in.  While this doc didn't cover much about his personal life at all, it was a pretty good capsule of his career and influences.

Title: The Cabin in the Woods
Review: Really great, possibly better the second time.

Title: Flight of the Navigator
Review: Not quite as great as I remembered it from childhood, but still not too shabby of a time-travel movie.

Title: Ricky Jay and His 52 Assistants
Review: Jay is a master with cards, and it is fascinating to watch him work.

Title: Staircases to Nowhere: Making Stanley Kubrick's 'The Shining' (Extended)
Review: Interviews with several crewmembers on The Shining.  Probably only interesting to real Shining degens.

Title: Richard Pryor: Omit the Logic
Review: Very good documentary covering Richard Pryor's career...

Title: Man of Steel
Review: Entertaining movie, threw away all of the camp, I wish it had also thrown out the origin story too but I lost that battle...  But it was pretty good anyway.  I look forward to the next installment now that th origin shit is out of the way.

Title: World War Z
Review: A pretty decent zombie movie, but definitely not a great one.  Kept me entertained, tho sagged in a few places.  Would have preferred family storyline was completely eliminated

Title: Good Will Hunting
Review: Hadn't seen this since before I had moved to Boston.  Better than I remembered...

Title: Downloaded
Review: Good history of the life and death of Napster, and an amazing reminder of how different things were 10-15 years ago..

Title: The Watch
Review: Not as bad as people made it out to be, but not all that great either.  Perfectly acceptable cable tv viewing, don't pay for it

Title: This Is The End
Review: A funny, raunchy comedy...  Not great, but amusing enough...

Title: Pacific Rim
Review: Sharks.  Monsters.  Awesome.

Title: Sharknado
Review: Dumb.

Title: Only God Forgives
Review: Beautiful film..  Plot is a little nonsense, but I didn't care because it was beautifully shot.  Always love Gosling, and he doesn't disappoint.

Title: Blitz
Review: A decent cop drama, a little amped up but not your usual Statham action flick.

Title: Innerspace
Review: Still pretty good, held up better than I expected of a childhood favorite

Title: Beavis and Butt-head Do America!
Review: For some reason I had a bad memory of this movie, but it is better than I remembered.

Title: Brother's Justice
Review: Tries a bit too hard but still pretty funny.  Pretty good for a bunch of actors fucking off.

Title: Stop Making Sense
Review: Amazing, as always.

Title: Oblivion
Review: Pretty meh.  About 30m too long and pretty derivative

Title: From One Second to the Next
Review: Gut-wrenching doc by Herzog profiling victims and those responsible for accidents caused by texting while driving.

Title: Elysium
Review: Johnny Mnemonic + Neuromancer with a dash of T2 and Mass Effect.

Title: Casting By
Review: A look into one of the most overlooked aspects of filmmaking, the casting process

Title: Pussy Riot: A Punk Prayer
Review: Such a sad yet inspiring story...

Title: American: The Bill Hicks Story
Review: A solid doc about yet another artists taken too early...

Title: The World's End
Review: Funny, maybe not as much as it's predecessors in the Cornetto Trilogy, but still quite funny.  If you liked their other films you'll like this one.

Title: Searching for Sugar Man
Review: Anyone who loves music should see this.

Title: Fat Man and Little Boy
Review: Has some typical "Hollywood drama" flaws, but still an enjoyable flilm.

Title: Riddick
Review: Immediately forgettable but fun anyway.  Not great, but entertaining.  Probably would make a great Netflix or Cable viewing.

Title: Frankenstein's Army
Review: Horrible.

Title: Museum Hours
Review: Felt like a movie that was trying WAY too hard to hit "arthouse" status.

Title: Star Trek: Into Darkness
Review: Still enjoyable, but the more I see of the past two Trek movies the more I want them to take this cast and make an original story

Title: Prisoners
Review: Way too long, stopped caring... With the usual twists and turns of a whodunnit police procedural it felt like the longest episode of Law & Order ever

Title: Gravity
Review: Amazing.  3D was worth it.

Title: Frontline: League of Denial
Review: I've been saying for years that football is a doomed sport.  I have a feeling this film (and book) might accelerate this process.

Title: Blue Caprice
Review: The killings themselves took a back seat to the relationship between the perpetrators of these crimes.  A very interesting way to frame the picture.

Title: Don Jon
Review: Good, not great.  Had some great ideas and was fun to watch. I look forward to JGLs future work

Title: The Trials of Muhammed Ali
Review: Very happy to see a doc on Ali that didn't focus as much on his boxing as it did his political/religious life.

Title: Twelve Years a Slave
Review: Amazing.

Title: Évocateur: The Morton Downey Jr. Movie
Review: Not quite enough there there.  Not bad, but needed some more something

Title: Inside Llewyn Davis
Review: Not for everyone, but I really enjoyed it.  You should be prepared for a study of a very unlikable character.

Title: The Wolverine (2013)
Review: Ok...  Kinda long and the action all ran together at parts.

Title: Dallas Buyers Club
Review: Great performances by Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto..  Really good film.

Title: Man of Steel
Review: Actually liked it better the second time...  Some of the directorial decisions seemed to make more sense for some reason.

Title: Team America: World Police
Review: Fuck Yeah!

Title: Europa Report
Review: Okay, but some really annoying aspects.  Jumping back and forth in time was irritating, and the suit cams pointing at their faces as opposed to what they were looking at was stupid.  Fairly straightforward crisis in space plot...

Title: Enough Said
Review: Perfectly nice little romantic comedy.

Title: The Pervert's Guide to Cinema
Review: It was hard for me to get past some of the psychobabble, but there is something mesmerizing about Zizek

Title: Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa
Review: Not great, but funny enough.  Cable viewing imo

Title: Cleanflix
Review: When I though it was over, it was only halfway done...

Title: The Visitor
Review: Wow.  I have no idea how this film got made, and I also don't know how it doesn't have more of a cult following.

Title: The Hunger Games
Review: Meh.  Too long, and by toning down the violence they managed to make things more uncomfortable...  As if kids killing each other was a casual thing.

Title: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
Review: Better than the first, could have lost some runtime and I went into it completely cold plotwise, so that might have helped.

Title: Jackass: The Movie
Review: Awesome as always.  I could watch any of the Jackass material at any time.

Title: Red Dawn
Review: Not Good-Bad bad, not Indignant bad, just bad.

Title: Olympus Has Fallen
Review: If you were looking for a mediocre remake of Die Hard set in the White House, this isn't a bad choice.  Perfectly reasonable dumb fun action movie.

Title: Rewind This!
Review: Good doc on the rise and fall of videotape.  Probably longer than it needed to be, but still lots of good information and nostalgia contained within.

Title: Spine Tingler! The William Castle Story
Review: A great bio of the master of schlocky horror gimmicks...

Title: MLB Official 2013 World Series Film
Review: What an amazing run.

Title: Nebraska
Review: A nice film, great performances, but the story was pretty standard and predictible.

Title: An Unreal Dream: The Michael Morton Story
Review: Incredible Story of a man who was wrongly convicted of the murder of his wife, and his exoneration decades later.

Title: Philomena
Review: Another sweet film, nice story and very well paced.

Title: The Wolf of Wall Street
Review: Really, really good...  I would say "Classic Scorcese", but this movie was funny in ways his previous work is not.

Title: Blackfish
Review: Depressing but good.  I've never had any interest in zoos or aquariums and this movie just reinforced that.

Title: The Iceman
Review: Michael Shannon always plays crazy well, but he did a particularly good job of capturing Kuklinski, who I remember from the HBO specials in the 90s.  Lots of surprising people cast in small roles.

Title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
Review: Hallelujah Holy Shit

Title: Bernie
Review: Still a funny little movie...  Plays to Jack Black's strengths well.
